intro: Dombeya ambohitrensis, commonly known as the Madagascar dombeya, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in terminal clusters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Dombeya ambohitrensis is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
